intro: Dorema aureum, commonly known as golden bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, silky hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Dorema aureum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and alpine settings.
